definition: first in rank or degree, a number that has no factor but itself and 1, insert a primer into (a gun, mine, or charge) preparatory to detonation or firing
details:
adjective
- first in rank or degree
= synonyms: premier
- used of the first or originating agent
- of superior grade
= synonyms: quality
- being at the best stage of development
= example: being at the best stage of development
= synonyms: meridian
- of or relating to or being an integer that cannot be factored into other integers
= example: of or relating to or being an integer that cannot be factored into other integers
noun
- a number that has no factor but itself and 1
= synonyms: prime quantity
- the time of maturity when power and vigor are greatest
= synonyms: prime of life
- the second canonical hour
- the period of greatest prosperity or productivity
= synonyms: flush
verb
- insert a primer into (a gun, mine, or charge) preparatory to detonation or firing
= example: insert a primer into (a gun, mine, or charge) preparatory to detonation or firing
- fill with priming liquid
= example: fill with priming liquid
- cover with a primer
= example: cover with a primer
= synonyms: undercoat
